metadata.title: CVE-2020-14318 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way samba handled file and directory permissions.An authenticated user could use this flaw to gain access to certain fileand directory information which otherwise would be unavailable to theattacker.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.32').
